channel.title: R Markdown on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in R Markdown on A Hugo website

item.title: Build a Spotify Playlist Recommendation Model With R
item.description:
Author: Ed Orlando Recognition & Credit This article and its contents were heavily influenced by Matt Danchoâ€™s Learning Labs Pro: Session #11.
Interactive Playlist Application If you are interested in creating your own playlist, please check out the Spotify Playlist Recommendation Shiny App.
Problem Statement Many companies and products you interact with every day include some type of Recommendation system. For example, the Netflix app recommends movies based on your history and what is trending.

item.title: Loading Multiple Files from Various Folders in R
item.description: Author: Ed Orlando Problem Statement This tutorial shows you how to load multiple files from multiple folders using R. As a bonus, this article will also show you how to add the folder and file names to the tibble. Load Libraries Tidyverse and readxl are the only libraries required for this tutorial. library(tidyverse) library(readxl) Data Description In this example, Spotify playlist data was downloaded using Exportify.

item.title: Gratitude and Motivation
item.description: Author: Ed Orlando First, I want to give a shout out to the team at White Lodging. Our team leader Adam Hutsler and Business Intelligence Manager Max Thomas are always coming up with creative ways to solve complex problems and create business value using Tableau and R. I also want to thank former Business Intelligence team members, Alex Williams and Troy Hill for their encouragement and advice throughout the years.
